body.section: Updating the Keystone Identity ServiceHP Helion OpenStack® allows you to perform updates on the following parts of the Identity service configuration::

ul.li: Any content in main keystone configuration file: /etc/keystone/keystone.conf. This allows to manipulate Keystone configuration parameters. Please refer to Updating main Keystone configuration file section below.
Updating certain configuration options and enabling features, such as:
Verbosity of logs being written to keystone log files.
Process counts for Apache2 WSGI module, separately for admin and public Keystone interfaces

Enabling/disabling Fernet Tokens.
Please refer to Enabling Keystone Features section below.

Creating and updating domain-specific configuration files: /etc/keystone/domains/keystone.<domain_name>.conf. This allows to integrate Keystone with one or more external authentication sources, such as LDAP server. Please refer to Integrating with an external LDAP server section below.

section.title: Updating the main Identity Service configuration file

ol.li:
The main Keystone Identity Service configuration file (/etc/keystone/keystone.conf), located on each control plane server is generated from the following template file located on a deployer: /home/stack/helion/my_cloud/config/keystone/keystone.conf.j2
Modify this template file as appropriate. Please refer to Keystone Kilo documentation for full descriptions of all settings: This is a Jinja2 template, which expects certain template variables to be set. Do not change values inside double curly braces: {{ }}.

Once the template is modified, commit the change to the local git repository, and rerun the configuration processor / deployment area preparation playbooks (as suggested at Using Git for Configuration Management): $ cd ~/helion $ git checkout site $ git add my_cloud/config/keystone/keystone.conf.j2 $ git commit -m "Adjusting some parameters in keystone.conf" $ cd ~/helion/hos/ansible $ ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost config-processor-run.yml $ ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost ready-deployment.yml 3. Run reconfiguration playbook in deployment area: $ cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible $ ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts keystone-reconfigure.yml

body.section:
Enabling Identity Service features To enable or disable Keystone features like Fernet Tokens, do the following:
Adjust respective parameters in /home/stack/helion/my_cloud/config/keystone/keystone_deploy_config.yml.
Commit the change into local git repository, and rerun configuration processor / deployment area preparation playbooks (as suggested at Using Git for Configuration Management):
$ cd ~/helion $ git checkout site $ git add my_cloud/config/keystone/keystone_deploy_config.yml $ git commit -m "Adjusting some WSGI or logging parameters for keystone" $ cd ~/helion/hos/ansible $ ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost config-processor-run.yml $ ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost ready-deployment.yml 3. Run reconfiguration playbook in deployment area: $ cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible $ ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts keystone-reconfigure.yml
